result.execSummary:
The defendant Mekhi O Cook-Bey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including DNA and as a condition of probation/extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owning is subject to civil judgment.
- Seek and maintain full-time employment or schooling.
Defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor. Defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.

- No possession of drugs.
- Not to possess or carry firearms.
COURT GRANTS EXPUNGEMENT UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF SENTENCE

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mekhi O Cook-Bey

records.addlTxt: Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. cmc
Letter from defendant re:  electronic monitoring/GPS.  (Mekhi O Cook-Bey - #128499, Racine County Jail, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI 53403).
Letter from defendant re:  electronic monitoring/GPS.  (Mekhi O Cook-Bey - #128499, Racine County Jail, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI 53403).

Defendant Mekhi O Cook-Bey in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. 

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint/Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 5 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR.  

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction with HUBER for work/school.
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/ extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-No possession of drugs.
-Not to possess or carry firearms.
-Seek and maintain full-time employment or schooling.
-Perform 25 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.

*Court GRANTS expungement upon successful completion of sentence.
*Defendant is REMANDED into custody.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Defendant Mekhi O Cook-Bey in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense in receipt of new offer and request an adjournment. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Mekhi O Cook-Bey in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Mekhi O Cook-Bey in court with Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
No driving without a valid license and follow all rules of the road.

Defendant Mekhi O Cook-Bey in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Mekhi O Cook-Bey in custody.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mekhi O Cook-Bey appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
